definition: clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: The president dispatched a messenger to tell the premier what happened.
sentences.chinese: 总统派出一名信使向首相禀报所发生的事。

sentences.english: The company has agencies in all parts of Africa.
sentences.chinese: 该公司在非洲各地设有派出机构。

sentences.english: Both factions field armies from the Roman Republic.
sentences.chinese: 两派都派出了罗马共和国军队。

sentences.english: We welcome the dispatch of the peace-keeping force.
sentences.chinese: 我们对派出维持和平部队此举表示欢迎。

sentences.english: New era brings forward new requirements for local police directors.
sentences.chinese: 新时期对公安派出所所长提出新的要求。

sentences.english: It seems that he will be sent abroad next year.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎明年将被派出国。

sentences.english: He was sent forth to scatter the leaflets.
Green sends in reinforcements to pick them up at the water tower.
sentences.chinese: 格林派出了增援去水塔接他们。

sentences.english: We sent a journalist, by rail, to Ashbury to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我们派出一名记者乘火车前往阿什伯里进行调查。

sentences.english: to formulate work plans for dispatching representatives of state stock ownership to the state holding and joint-stock corporations.
sentences.chinese: 拟订向国有控股和参股公司派出国有股权代表的方案。

sentences.english: China's peace-keepers have joined United Nations peace-keeping operations.
sentences.chinese: 中国派出了维和人员参与联合国的维和行动。

sentences.english: The round-visiting village police system is a model of police tasks in the practice of reform of the countryside local police station.
sentences.chinese: 巡访村警制是农村派出所改革实践中的一种警务模式。

sentences.english: Paphos Gate police station is continuing investigations.
sentences.chinese: 帕福斯门派出所正在继续调查。

sentences.english: The Germans showed up with a shitload of guys and half a dozen tanks.
sentences.chinese: 德军派出了一大坨士兵和六辆坦克。

sentences.english: God sent representatives and told them to teach the people to be more than people.
sentences.chinese: 神派出代表们让他们去教导人们要不仅只做人。

sentences.english: How many male that the school sent at least?
sentences.chinese: 问某校最少派出有多少名男学生？

definition: to start out on a trip/to dispatch troops
to go to war/to engage in war
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
